title: Walnut Canyon monument closed during helicopter operations
text:
FLAGSTAFF, Ariz. (AP) - A national monument near Flagstaff will be closed for two days while a helicopter delivers material to widen a trail.

Walnut Canyon National Monument will be closed to visitors Thursday and Friday. It’s about 10 miles (16 kilometers) southeast of Flagstaff.

Rock and other material will be transported via long-line helicopter to the Island Trail that’s 185 feet (56 meters) below the canyon rim.

The trail is 1 mile (1.6 kilometers) round-trip and takes visitors past more than two dozen ancient cliff dwellings.

About 300 people visit the monument during the weekdays this time of year.
